taxonomicnotes: There is clear evidence that C. gachua as presently understood is a species complex.  Early information from current research indicates that the group represents at least 3-4 species (R. Britz pers. comm.).  Taxonomic revision is required.
rationale: Channa gachua is considered to be a species complex and assessment and requires taxonomic revision. However, as currently understood, the species has a very wide range and is without majour widespread threats, and it is assessed as Least Concern. It should be -re-assessed following taxonomic review to confirm the validity and distribution of the species.
evaluator: Jha, B.R., Datta, N.C., Britz, R., Dey, S.C., Vishwanath, W. & Allen, D.J.
